Books

Journal Articles
Themistocleous Charalambos, Eckerström Marie, and Dimitrios Kokkinakis (2018). Identification of Mild Cognitive Impairment from Speech in Swedish using Deep Sequential Neural Networks. Frontiers in Neurology. doi: 10.3389/fneur.2018.00975.
Valantis Fyndanis and Charalambos Themistocleous (2018) Are there prototypical associations between time frames and aspectual values? Evidence from Greek aphasia and healthy ageing. Clinical Linguistics & Phonetics. DOI: 10.1080/02699206.2018.1480657
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2017). Effects of two linguistically proximal varieties on the spectral and coarticulatory properties of fricatives: Evidence from Athenian Greek and Cypriot Greek. Frontiers in Psychology. DOI: 10.3389/fpsyg.2017.01945
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2017). Dialect classification using vowel acoustic parameters. Speech Communication 94, 13 -22. DOI: 10.1016/j.specom.2017.05.003.
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2017). Modern Greek vowels and the nature of acoustic gradience. Phonetica 74, 157–172. PMID: 28268213, DOI: 10.1159/000450554.
Grohmann Kleanthes, Papadopoulou Elena and Themistocleous Charalambos (2017). Acquiring Clitic Placement in Bilectal Settings: Interactions between Social Factors. Frontiers in Communication 2:5. doi:10.3389/fcomm.2017.00005.
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2016). Seeking an anchorage: Evidence from the tonal alignment of the Cypriot Greek prenuclear pitch accent. Language and Speech, 59(4):433–461, DOI: 10.1177/0023830915614602.
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2016). The bursts of stops can convey dialectal information. Journal of the Acoustical Society of America EL 140(4), EL334–EL340. http://dx.doi.org/10.1121/1.4964818.
Themistocleous, Charalambos (2014). Edge-Tone Effects and Prosodic Domain Effects on Final Lengthening. Linguistic Variation 14(1). 129–160. DOI: 10.1075/lv.14.1.06the.
